alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Latimer; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 21 at 11:19PM CST until February 22 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Crawford, Franklin and Sebastian. In Oklahoma, Haskell, Latimer, Le Flore and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 230 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1119 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Poteau... Stigler... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... Mulberry... Panama... Dyer... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
